channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The European Union hits Apple and Meta with 700 million euros in fines
item.description: European Union watchdogs fined Apple and Facebook's parent company hundreds of millions of euros as they stepped up enforcement of the 27-nation bloc'...

item.title: Stocks gain on hopes Trump will ease tensions with the Fed -- and China
item.description: The Dow Jones advanced after Trump said he wouldn't fire Fed Chair Jerome Powell and on hopes of easing tensions over tariffs with China.

item.title: Bernie Sanders says Democrats have 'paid a political price' for not listening to the working class

item.title: NIH autism study will pull from private medical records
item.description: The National Institutes of Health plans to pool information from private sources like pharmacies and smartwatches.

item.title: Who are the cardinals selecting the next pope?
item.description: The conclave to select a new pope will be sharply different from the body that chose Francis in 2013. Experts say that could make it harder to predict...

item.title: Apr 23: CBS News 24/7, 1pm ET

item.title: Abbas calls Hamas 'sons of dogs' and demands release of Gaza hostages
item.description: Palestinian Authority president says that Hamas has given Israel "excuses" to continue the Gaza war.

item.title: Survivors of 2022 July Fourth parade mass shooting describe chaos, panic and bloodshed
India closes main border crossing with Pakistan after Kashmir attack
item.description: Visas held by some Pakistanis are also cancelled after gunmen killed tourists in Indian-administered Kashmir.

item.title: Trump accuses Zelensky of harming Ukraine peace negotiations
item.description: The comments came after Kyiv rejected suggestions it could recognise Russian control of Crimea.

item.title: Opportunity for big US-China trade deal, says Bessent
item.description: The comments from the US Treasury Secretary come as the trade war between the world's two biggest economies has escalated.

item.title: Violinmaking: A historic art

item.title: Harvey Weinstein's rape retrial begins in New York
item.description: Weinstein, who has pleaded not guilty to sex crimes, returns to court after a conviction was overturned.
